SleepyTunes is developed by David Qian, a Software Engineering student at the University of Waterloo. 

Artwork for this project was developed by Jason Sun, a Computer Science student at the University of Toronto.

The project used API from the open source framework "achartengine." This project uses the typeface "Roboto" created by the artist Christian Robertson. 

This project is licensed under the Apache 2.0 license.
For more information about me and my other projects, check out my personal website at: 

davidqian.ca.

2015 David Qian

SleepyTunes makes it easier for you to fall asleep while listening to your favourite music! This application will slowly decrease the volume to zero based on a timer you set. To use, simply play music from a 3rd party application (playlists or the radio) and set an initial volume using the volume up and down buttons. When you\'re ready, head back into the app and select a timer and method of decay. Note that you cannot adjust the volume afterwards. That\'s it! Hope you enjoy this app!
